oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John Sevier to to Colonel R.J. Meigs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter addressed to Colonel J. Meigs from Governor John Sevier that describes the sale of a "negro lad named Andy" to Double Head, a Cherokee man.

In the late 18th century, white plantation owners encouraged American Indians to participate in the practice of slavery. Out of the five major tribes, the Cherokee were the primary participants in the practice. The Cherokee slavery system resembled the white plantation system, including the sale and trade of enslaved African Americans.
